Welcome!

My name is Edward Laurence and I'm a PhD student in physics at Université Laval. I've just placed this text so you won't scroll down and you'll see the cool (or laggy) background animation.

  • March 19, 2018

    Two new papers in Phys. Rev. E

    The papers entitled “Exact analytical solution of irreversible binary dynamics on network” and “Geometric evolution of complex networks” have been accepted and published in Phys. Rev. E. The latter introduces a new geometric model of complex networks. In doing so, we interpolate and quantify the phase transition of the network...

  • March 1, 2018

    5000 downloads!

    My Garmin watch face has just hit a new major step! For the occasion, I’ve created a unique background header for this post. Enjoy!

    New website!

  • November 9, 2017

    Exact solution of binary dynamics

    I’m proud to release a paper called Exact analytical solution of irreversible binary dynamics on networks. Our contribution is analytic and numerical in nature. We obtain an analytical solution to cascade dynamics and propose an algorithm to solve the equations as efficiently as possible. We made available the code solving...

  • August 30, 2017

    Annual Sentinel North Conference

    After weeks of work, my study of the networks of Sentinel North has finally been presented by Patrick Desrosiers at the annual Sentinel North conference. I also had the opportunity to give a blitz talk of three minutes, a unique opportunity to practice communication skills.
